content: We will probably want to figure out a way to document the hotkey(s) only available in the desktop app (like switching organization)

Yep, agreed. One way to do it is just detect whether we're in the desktop app (there's a few ways we can do this from JS or even the Python backend; simplest is checking User-agent for ZulipElectron) and just have a conditional based on that in the template. Another option would be to have a "Desktop app only" section.
We could also add a keyboard shortcut page within the desktop app, somewhere in settings page.
If we are only going to have a few keyboard shortcuts for the app, it probably makes sense to document them in the same place we document other keyboard shortcuts.
We also have an issue open for documenting the Mac version of the hotkeys
I think the conditional strategy is the way to do it, over having a separate page.
